trans-unit.source: Change Azure AD Connect Default Configuration
trans-unit.target: Change Azure AD Connect Default Configuration

trans-unit.source: Learn how to change default configuration for Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to change default configuration for Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: Changing the Azure AD Connect default configuration
trans-unit.target: Changing the Azure AD Connect default configuration

trans-unit.source: The default configuration of Azure AD Connect in most instances is sufficient to easily extend your on-premises directories into the cloud.
trans-unit.target: The default configuration of Azure AD Connect in most instances is sufficient to easily extend your on-premises directories into the cloud.

trans-unit.source: However there are certain instances when you may need to modify the default and tailor it to your organizations business logic.
trans-unit.target: However there are certain instances when you may need to modify the default and tailor it to your organizations business logic.

trans-unit.source: In these instances you can modify the default configuration however there are some things you need to be aware of before you do this.
trans-unit.target: In these instances you can modify the default configuration however there are some things you need to be aware of before you do this.

trans-unit.source: When you need to change the default configuration, do the following:
trans-unit.target: When you need to change the default configuration, do the following:

trans-unit.source: When you need to modify an attribute flow of an “out-of-box” synchronization rule, do not change it.
trans-unit.target: When you need to modify an attribute flow of an “out-of-box” synchronization rule, do not change it.

trans-unit.source: Instead, create a new synchronization rule with a higher precedence (lower numeric value) that contains your required attribute flow.
trans-unit.target: Instead, create a new synchronization rule with a higher precedence (lower numeric value) that contains your required attribute flow.

trans-unit.source: Export your custom synchronization rules using the Synchronization Rules Editor.
trans-unit.target: Export your custom synchronization rules using the Synchronization Rules Editor.

trans-unit.source: This provides you with a PowerShell script you can use to easily recreate them in the case of a disaster recovery scenario.
trans-unit.target: This provides you with a PowerShell script you can use to easily recreate them in the case of a disaster recovery scenario.

trans-unit.source: If you need to change the scope or the join setting in an “out-of-box” synchronization rule, document this and reapply the change after upgrading to a newer version of Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: If you need to change the scope or the join setting in an “out-of-box” synchronization rule, document this and reapply the change after upgrading to a newer version of Azure AD Connect.
